instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , no back light...  now i change the led driver ... getting around 19v in back light rail. when i did connect the power from logicboard screen blink . with light .... im thinking which rail control the back light brightness might be down any , idea thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 10959"]Voltage on pin 2 and 7 of <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>?[/QUOTE]

pic 2 =3.2v,  pin 7=0.14v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message: Oops I meant 2 and 4, but I guess 4 will be present. VIN voltage on pin 23?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 10962"]Oops I meant 2 and 4, but I guess 4 will be present. VIN voltage on pin 23?[/QUOTE]

pin2=3.2v, 4=3.1v, 23=12.6

pin 21=20 v

threads.message: Here the setup , of I disconnect the power there is blink of back light for .001 sec

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message: Strange, it is boosting but 20V is not enough. Was the problem the same before changing the chip with the 20V on the output?
